meanings.sent1: I helped my friends reconcile after their argument.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were able to reconcile their differences and make up.
meanings.sent3: The two cats seemed to reconcile their fight by sharing a sunny spot.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to reconcile the conflicting emotions within me.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset helped reconcile the couple's disagreement.

meanings.definition: Make or show to be compatible.
meanings.sent1: She tried to reconcile her love for art with her fear of failure.
meanings.sent2: The chef had to reconcile the flavors in the dish to make it perfect.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces didn't fit together until she tried to reconcile them.
meanings.sent4: His words and actions never seemed to reconcile with each other.
meanings.sent5: The colors in the painting seemed to reconcile perfectly, creating a harmonious blend.

meanings.sent1: The mediator helped the two parties reconcile their differences.
meanings.sent2: They finally decided to reconcile their argument and move forward.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a pizza party helped them reconcile their dispute.
meanings.sent4: The negotiation skills of the lawyer helped reconcile the legal matter.
meanings.sent5: The compromise reached by the team helped reconcile the conflicting opinions.
